subject: Photography
title: Shooting Through Obstacles
description: Learn Shooting Through Obstacles in one minute.

hook.text: Shoot through a rain-streaked window, a chain-link fence, or a crowd of blurred heads. Obstacles add layers.

buildup.text: Placing objects between the camera and the subject creates depth, mystery, and a voyeuristic feeling.

discovery.text: A blurred foreground object â€” like a plant or a glass pane â€” adds atmosphere without distracting from the subject.

twist.text: This technique breaks the clean-frame rule. It introduces 'imperfection' that paradoxically makes images feel more real.

climax.text: Shooting through obstacles turns the viewer into a participant â€” peering through, not just looking at.

punchline.text: Sometimes the best view is through something else.

quiz.question: What does shooting through foreground obstacles create?
options: Depth, mystery, and a sense of being immersed in the scene
